name: GoSweat
slogan: GoSweat gives employees access to 1,000s of fitness and wellbeing experiences
description: At GoSweat, we are redefining workplace wellness. We help improve employee health, happiness and well-being through thousands of fitness experiences that appeal to every individual. We are a fast paced, people focused startup on a journey to redefine this entire sector, helping create a better and healthier working population.

jobs.title: Junior UX/UI Designer
jobs.description: GoSweat are looking for an ambitious junior UX/UI designer to join our growing product team. You will have the opportunity to take ownership of the visual design and UX of the GoSweat product, shaping our offering in 2020. As a successful and rapidly growing start-up, we are building a closely bonded, highly capable team tasked with taking the current system to an enterprise-quality product to match the needs of our latest clients.  For us, it is crucial that our team live, breath and experience the product.

jobs.title: Office Manager and Customer Support Specialist
jobs.description:
GoSweat is looking to hire a ‘people’s person’ to join our growing team as an ‘Office Manager / Customer Support Specialist’ who is:

- Excellent at quickly building relationships, with the charm and wit to make our customers love you!
- Genuinely empathetic so you can listen keenly to customer challenges and work hard to resolve them fast
- A great communicator with exceptional written and spoken English - as comfortable on the phone as meeting in person or talking over chat
- Diligent, organised and resilient - these will be busy, fast-paced days and need someone who can work effectively and efficiently under pressure
- Passionate about small businesses, eager to help them to Make Work Better
- Someone early on in their career who is looking for a challenge
- Social and able to rally the GoSweat team and organize fun socials and keep the office stocked and running smoothly 


Duties and essential job functions: 

- Be the first port of call for customer interactions across every touchpoint, ensuring everyone who uses our product becomes our greatest advocates
- Be responsible for all support channels in the business: email, phone & being the champion for live chat
- Take the lead on educating users on how GoSweat can make a difference in their lives
- Seize opportunities to represent our users to the Product Team, making sure their feedback is shared on a regular cadence
- Make sure the rest of the company stays customer-focused, working with the rest of the customer team to plan a best in class engagement strategy
- Be focused on constantly looking for ways to always optimise and streamline our support process
- Provide ad hoc support to other areas of the business; we're a small and agile team so you’ll get the opportunity to work with a variety of roles


What we’ll provide:

- Competitive salary £20-22k base salary depending on experience
- Substantial Equity in the business
- Annual offsite: we organize a retreat once a year where the whole company gets together
- £50 a month wellbeing budget
- Laptop
- 33 Days holiday a year
- Regular socials and early drinks on a Friday
- A comfortable dog-friendly office in Bermondsey stocked with fruit, tea/coffee, snacks, ice creams, and a drinks fridge
- Career progression and development
- An open and democratic work culture where everyone can contribute, learn and teach
- Employer’s pension scheme


From our small beginnings to our major growth phase, we expect everyone to give their very best. We are an equal opportunities employer and believe in the power of a diverse, inclusive team. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified people, regardless of race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

jobs.title: Sales Development Representative
jobs.description:
GoSweat is looking to hire ‘hungry’ Sales Development Representatives, who can: 


- Celebrate their successes (of which there will be many)
- Identify new opportunities, qualify and contact potential leads
- Run a smooth process from initial outreach via email, phone or LinkedIn, to the qualification of these opportunities 

You are:

- Process-driven - you relish in following a process and getting the job done
- Someone who likes to win - you’re hungry to succeed and to celebrate your successes (of which there will be many)
- Articulate, clear and concise - people pay attention when you speak
- Conscientious and confident - you’re not afraid to engage with prospects
- Independent and self-motivated - you love to get your hands dirty
- KPI and target driven - numbers matter
- Interested in starting a career in sales - this is a great foot in the door and you’re excited to progress to one-day closing deals
- Someone who loves problem-solving and innovating
- A super-fast learner
- A person that gets things done


Essential skills:

- You have great attention to detail
- You can handle feedback 
- You have strong admin and writing skills
- You’re persistent, patient, don't get discouraged and, when you meet or speak to difficult people, you can brush it off and get back on your A-game


Duties and essential job functions: 

- Manage lead generation with the aim of collating the best prospects to engage with. We currently work with some of the most impactful companies in the world, who really value their employees, so quality is key 
- Engage with prospects via email, phone, LinkedIn 
- Maintain pipeline with a measurable persistence around lead development which includes call and email engagement
- Speak to prospective companies and schedule meetings with them for the - - Sales Manager (and you, in some instances) to attend 
- Attend some meetings and share follow-up materials/comms until the point of close
- Receive and qualify inbound sales calls/messages
- Work closely with other departments to ensure completion of the sale and/or other sales operations requirements
- Proactively cold call prospective companies for business development


What we’ll provide:

- Competitive salary £20-22k base salary depending on experience, up to £25k OTE in year 1
- Substantial Equity in the business
- Annual offsite: we organize a retreat once a year where the whole company gets together
- £50 a month wellbeing budget
- Laptop
- 33 Days holiday a year
- Regular socials and early drinks on a Friday
- A comfortable dog-friendly office in Bermondsey stocked with fruit, tea/coffee, snacks, ice creams, and a drinks fridge
- Career progression and development
- An open and democratic work culture where everyone can contribute, learn and teach
- Employer’s pension scheme


From our small beginnings to our major growth phase, we expect everyone to give their very best. We are an equal opportunities employer and believe in the power of a diverse, inclusive team. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified people, regardless of race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

jobs.title: Sales Executive
jobs.description:
GoSweat is looking to hire a passionate Sales Executive, who can: 


- Celebrate their successes (of which there will be many)
- Meet and establish relationships with prospective companies
- Sell GoSweat’s employee benefit into the prospective companies, so that their employees can start benefiting from GoSweat

You are:

- Someone who likes to win - you’re hungry to succeed and to celebrate your successes (of which there will be many)
- Persistent but respectful - this job will require you to close deals from meetings 
- Articulate, clear and concise - people pay attention when you speak
- Conscientious and confident - you’re not afraid to engage with prospects
- Presentable - a lot of the job will be F-2-F so smart (not suits) is a must
- KPI and target driven - numbers matter
- Empathetic and adaptable - you’re able to think on your feet and adapt based on what people say
- Process-driven - you relish in following a process and getting the job done
- A super-fast learner
- A person that gets things done


Essential skills:

- You are personable and adaptable  
- You can handle feedback 
- You have strong negotiating skills 
- You’re persistent, patient, don't get discouraged and, when you meet or speak to difficult people, you can brush it off and get back on your A-game


Duties and essential job functions: 

- Have meetings with ‘warm’ companies that have been qualified over the phone by SDR’s
- Meet and sell GoSweat to said companies, and convey the value of GoSweat, so that they understand exactly why their employees need GoSweat as an employee benefit
- Maintain pipeline with a measurable persistence, following meetings so that ‘warm’ leads turn hot and ‘hot’ leads convert
- Close deals and pass on to engagement team to host launch event
- Maintain a degree of account management after a company has launched, to ensure smooth transition 
- Share follow-up materials/comms until the point of close
- Work closely with other departments to ensure completion of the sale and/or other sales operations requirements


What we’ll provide:

- Competitive salary £25-28k base salary depending on experience, up to £35k - OTE in year 1
- Substantial Equity in the business
- Annual offsite: we organize a retreat once a year where the whole company gets together
- £50 a month wellbeing budget
- Laptop
- 33 Days holiday a year
- Regular socials and early drinks on a Friday
- A comfortable dog-friendly office in Bermondsey stocked with fruit, tea/coffee, snacks, ice creams, and a drinks fridge
- Career progression and development
- An open and democratic work culture where everyone can contribute, learn and teach
- Employer’s pension scheme


From our small beginnings to our major growth phase, we expect everyone to give their very best. We are an equal opportunities employer and believe in the power of a diverse, inclusive team. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified people, regardless of race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

jobs.title: Sales and Account Manager (for Fitness and Wellbeing Providers)
jobs.description:
GoSweat is looking to hire ‘ambitious’ Sales & Account Manager Manager, who can take charge of signing up and managing the best fitness and wellbeing providers the UK has to offer.


You are:

- Process-driven - you relish in following a process and getting the job done
- Someone who likes to win - you’re hungry to succeed and to celebrate your successes (of which there will be many)
- Articulate, clear and concise - people pay attention when you speak
- Conscientious and confident - you’re not afraid to engage with prospects
- Independent and self-motivated - you love to get your hands dirty
- KPI and target driven - numbers matter
- Interested in starting a career in sales - this is a great foot in the door
- Someone who loves problem-solving and innovating
- A super-fast learner
- A person that gets things done


Essential skills:

- You have great attention to detail
- You can handle feedback 
- You have strong admin and writing skills
- You’re persistent, patient, don't get discouraged and, when you meet or speak to difficult people, you can brush it off and get back on your A-game
